cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 25 miles NE of Freeport, Grand Bahama Island
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to drift WNW overnight, then turn northwest on Tuesday and curve north-northeast paralleling the Florida coast, moving dangerously close to the Georgia and South Carolina coasts Wednesday night into Thursday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Closest coastal encounter along the Georgia/South Carolina coast between Savannah GA and Charleston SC

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Ponte Vedra Beach, FL to South Santee River, SC (includes the Georgia coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Warning: Lantana, FL to Altamaha Sound, GA; Hurricane Warning: Jupiter Inlet, FL to Ponte Vedra Beach, FL; Tropical Storm Warning: North of Deerfield Beach, FL to Jupiter Inlet, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast, Georgia coast (including Savannah), South Carolina coast, then northward toward the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (gale) likely Wednesday night with a 63% cumulative chance; hurricane-force gusts possible if the core tracks closer.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential life-threatening surge of 4–7 ft above ground during high tide for the Georgia coast including Savannah River entrance.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall of 4–8 in (locally up to 10 in) could cause flash flooding in coastal Georgia.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; large breaking waves in the harbor approaches; isolated tornadoes possible Wednesday–Thursday.
